title: WCAS HISTORY 395-0-20 Research Seminar

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This seminar aims to provide students with an opportunity to explore the intellectual exchanges between, and cross pollination among, thinkers from both Arab and European/American societies in the modern period (especially since the mid-19th century). Our main focus will be on the Arab intellectuals and their literary output. Following some core readings, students will work toward the production of a term paper based on primary sources. Depending on the students' linguistic abilities and/or the availability of translations, possible topics might include the rise of nationalist ideas and other political mass ideologies, the impact of the social sciences on Islamic scholarship, changing views of socio-political "progress," and the question of feminism. The seminar will also cover some methodological issues to help students with the writing process.
